# Kirghiz Autonomous Socialist Soviet Republic (1926–1936)

}}
The Kirghiz Autonomous Socialist Soviet Republic (, ) was an autonomous republic of the Soviet Union within the Russian Socialist Federative Soviet Republic existing from 1926 until 1936.
The Kirghiz ASSR was created on 1 February 1926 in the former region of Soviet Central Asia, within the Russian SFSR, when the Kirghiz AO was reorganized as an ASSR. On 5 December 1936, it was elevated to the Kirghiz SSR (independent of the Russian SFSR), one of the constituent republics of the Soviet Union.

Map
Map of Kirghiz Autonomous Socialist Soviet Republic in [https://www.prlib.ru/item/397253#v=d&z=2&n=5&i=4961059_doc1_BDA645F8-11D0-44FE-97D2-DB8F4C9B6FC2.tiff&y=591&x=503 Енукидзе А. С. (1928). Атлас Союза Советских Социалистических Республик, p. 66a] [Document page 121].
